授業方法:
*The format and schedule may change during the semester, depending on student needs and the evolving coronavirus situation.

This seminar style class will be conducted face to face. However, assignments/homework will be conducted and lesson resources/ information provided on Edmodo. As such, students will need access to a computer. BYOD to class is recommended- laptop, tablet, or smartphone. Short lectures will be given by the instructor each week. Students are expected to take notes, as these lectures will introduce the themes of the course. Supplementary readings will be assigned for homework to introduce additional information and deepen students’ understanding. Students will also do further research on these topics.

Students will have to regularly demonstrate detailed and critical understanding of the content of these lectures and readings, as they will form the basis of written assignments, and active discussions or presentations in spoken English in the following class. Students will be asked to rent at least one movie to watch during this course.

Outside of class:
- Most weeks you will read and analyse articles. These support short lectures delivered in class, and form the basis for in-class written responses and discussions. This should take approximately 1 hour a week. Students will be asked to rent at least one movie to watch during this course.
- In addition, please review each lesson, and check any new content, language or skills learned. This should take approximately 30 minutes a week.
- Written responses and active participation in class discussions are a big part of the grade for this course. Insufficient preparation outside class will severely affect your grade.
- Access any online material required. Some assignments may involve doing additional online research.
